name: Snapshot
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Pub/Sub.

First, install @google-cloud/pubsub with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/pubsub

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/pubsubâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')();

Elsewhere

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/pubsub are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Snapshot
methods.description:
A Snapshot object will give you access to your Cloud Pub/Sub snapshot.

Snapshots are sometimes retrieved when using various methods:

  • pubsub#getSnapshots
  • pubsub#getSnapshotsStream
  • pubsub#snapshot

Snapshots may be created with:

  • pubsub/subscription#createSnapshot

You can use snapshots to seek a subscription to a specific point in time.

  • pubsub/subscription#seek

examples.caption: From pubsub#getSnapshots:
From pubsub#getSnapshotsStream:
From pubsub#snapshot:
examples.code:
var snapshot = pubsub.snapshot('my-snapshot');
// snapshot is a Snapshot object.

examples.caption: Create a snapshot with pubsub/subscription#createSnapshot:
Seek to your snapshot:

methods.name: create
methods.description:
Create a snapshot with the given name.

This is only available if you accessed this object through pubsub/subscription#snapshot.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.description: • An error from the API call, may be null.

params.description: • The full API response from the service.

methods.name: seek
methods.description:
Seeks an existing subscription to the snapshot.

This is only available if you accessed this object through pubsub/subscription#snapshot.
